# Flowable Process REST API v1

> Scroll down for code samples, example requests and responses. Select a language for code samples from the tabs above or the mobile navigation menu.

# flowable / flow??b(??)l /

- a compact and highly efficient workflow and Business Process Management (BPM) platform for developers, system admins and business users.
- a lightning fast, tried and tested BPMN 2 process engine written in Java. It is Apache 2.0 licensed open source, with a committed community.
- can run embedded in a Java application, or as a service on a server, a cluster, and in the cloud. It integrates perfectly with Spring. With a rich Java and REST API, it is the ideal engine for orchestrating human or system activities.

Base URLs:

* <a href="http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service">http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service</a>

* <a href="https://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service">https://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service</a>



Web: <a href="http://www.flowable.org/">Flowable</a> 
License: <a href="http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html">Apache 2.0</a>

# Forms

## Get form data

> Code samples

```shell
# You can also use wget
curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

```

```http
GET http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080

Accept: application/json

```

```javascript
var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})
```

```javascript--nodejs
const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});
```

```ruby
require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)
```

```python
import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()
```

```java
URL obj = new URL("http://localhost:8080/flowable-rest/service/form/form-data");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());
```

`GET /form/form-data`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
taskId|query|string|false|No description
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|No description


> Example responses

```json
{
  "formKey": "null",
  "deploymentId": "2",
  "processDefinitionId": "3",
  "processDefinitionUrl": "http://localhost:8182/repository/process-definition/3",
  "taskId": "6",
  "taskUrl": "http://localhost:8182/runtime/task/6",
  "formProperties": [
    {
      "id": "room",
      "name": "Room",
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string",
      "readable": true,
      "writable": true,
      "required": true,
      "datePattern": "string",
      "enumValues": [
        {
          "id": "normal",
          "name": "Normal bed"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```
### Responses

Status|Meaning|Description|Schema
---|---|---|---|
200|[OK](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.1)|Indicates that form data could be queried.|[FormDataResponse](#schemaformdataresponse)
404|[Not Found](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4)|Indicates that form data could not be found.|None

`GET /history/historic-activity-instances`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
activityId|query|string|false|An id of the activity instance.
activityInstanceId|query|string|false|An id of the historic activity instance.
activityName|query|string|false|The name of the historic activity instance.
activityType|query|string|false|The element type of the historic activity instance.
executionId|query|string|false|The execution id of the historic activity instance.
finished|query|boolean|false|Indication if the historic activity instance is finished.
taskAssignee|query|string|false|The assignee of the historic activity instance.
processInstanceId|query|string|false|The process instance id of the historic activity instance.
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|The process definition id of the historic activity instance.
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return instances with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return instances with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

`GET /history/historic-detail/{detailId}/data`

The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description

detailId|path|string|true|No description

404|[Not Found](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4)|Indicates the requested historic detail instance was not found or the historic detail instance doesn?t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn?t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.|None

`GET /history/historic-process-instances`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
processInstanceId|query|string|false|An id of the historic process instance.
processDefinitionKey|query|string|false|The process definition key of the historic process instance.
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|The process definition id of the historic process instance.
businessKey|query|string|false|The business key of the historic process instance.
involvedUser|query|string|false|An involved user of the historic process instance.
finished|query|boolean|false|Indication if the historic process instance is finished.
superProcessInstanceId|query|string|false|An optional parent process id of the historic process instance.
excludeSubprocesses|query|boolean|false|Return only historic process instances which aren?t sub processes.
finishedAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic process instances that were finished after this date.
finishedBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic process instances that were finished before this date.
startedAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic process instances that were started after this date.
startedBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic process instances that were started before this date.
startedBy|query|string|false|Return only historic process instances that were started by this user.
includeProcessVariables|query|boolean|false|An indication if the historic process instance variables should be returned as well.
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return instances with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return instances with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

processDefinitionName|query|string|false|The process definition name of the historic task instance.
processDefinitionNameLike|query|string|false|The process definition name of the historic task instance, which matches the given value.
processBusinessKey|query|string|false|The process instance business key of the historic task instance.
processBusinessKeyLike|query|string|false|The process instance business key of the historic task instance that matches the given value.
executionId|query|string|false|The execution id of the historic task instance.
taskDefinitionKey|query|string|false|The task definition key for tasks part of a process
taskName|query|string|false|The task name of the historic task instance.
taskNameLike|query|string|false|The task name with like operator for the historic task instance.
taskDescription|query|string|false|The task description of the historic task instance.
taskDescriptionLike|query|string|false|The task description with like operator for the historic task instance.
taskCategory|query|string|false|Select tasks with the given category. Note that this is the task category, not the category of the process definition (namespace within the BPMN Xml).
taskDeleteReason|query|string|false|The task delete reason of the historic task instance.
taskDeleteReasonLike|query|string|false|The task delete reason with like operator for the historic task instance.
taskAssignee|query|string|false|The assignee of the historic task instance.
taskAssigneeLike|query|string|false|The assignee with like operator for the historic task instance.
taskOwner|query|string|false|The owner of the historic task instance.
taskOwnerLike|query|string|false|The owner with like operator for the historic task instance.
taskInvolvedUser|query|string|false|An involved user of the historic task instance
taskPriority|query|string|false|The priority of the historic task instance.
finished|query|boolean|false|Indication if the historic task instance is finished.
processFinished|query|boolean|false|Indication if the process instance of the historic task instance is finished.
parentTaskId|query|string|false|An optional parent task id of the historic task instance.
dueDate|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have a due date equal this date.
dueDateAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have a due date after this date.
dueDateBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have a due date before this date.
withoutDueDate|query|boolean|false|Return only historic task instances that have no due-date. When false is provided as value, this parameter is ignored.
taskCompletedOn|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have been completed on this date.
taskCompletedAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have been completed after this date.
taskCompletedBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that have been completed before this date.
taskCreatedOn|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that were created on this date.
taskCreatedBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that were created before this date.
taskCreatedAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Return only historic task instances that were created after this date.
includeTaskLocalVariables|query|boolean|false|An indication if the historic task instance local variables should be returned as well.
includeProcessVariables|query|boolean|false|An indication if the historic task instance global variables should be returned as well.
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return historic task instances with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return historic task instances with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns historic task instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

`POST /query/historic-task-instances`

potentialStarter|query|string|false|Only return groups which members are potential starters for a process-definition with the given id.

`GET /management/deadletter-jobs`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
id|query|string|false|Only return job with the given id
processInstanceId|query|string|false|Only return jobs part of a process with the given id
executionId|query|string|false|Only return jobs part of an execution with the given id
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given process definition id
timersOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are timers. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'messagesOnly'.
messagesOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are messages. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'timersOnly'
withException|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs for which an exception occurred while executing it. If false, this parameter is ignored.
dueBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed before the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
dueAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed after the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
exceptionMessage|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given exception message
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return jobs with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns jobs without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
locked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are locked.  If false, this parameter is ignored.
unlocked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are unlocked. If false, this parameter is ignored.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.


#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
sort|id|
sort|dueDate|
sort|executionId|
sort|processInstanceId|
sort|retries|
sort|tenantId|

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
id|query|string|false|Only return job with the given id

processDefinitionId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given process definition id
timersOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are timers. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'messagesOnly'.
messagesOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are messages. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'timersOnly'
withException|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs for which an exception occurred while executing it. If false, this parameter is ignored.
dueBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed before the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
dueAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed after the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
exceptionMessage|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given exception message
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return jobs with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns jobs without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
locked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are locked.  If false, this parameter is ignored.
unlocked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are unlocked. If false, this parameter is ignored.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.

`GET /management/timer-jobs`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
id|query|string|false|Only return job with the given id
processInstanceId|query|string|false|Only return jobs part of a process with the given id
executionId|query|string|false|Only return jobs part of an execution with the given id
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given process definition id
timersOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are timers. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'messagesOnly'.
messagesOnly|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are messages. If false, this parameter is ignored. Cannot be used together with 'timersOnly'
withException|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs for which an exception occurred while executing it. If false, this parameter is ignored.
dueBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed before the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
dueAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return jobs which are due to be executed after the given date. Jobs without duedate are never returned using this parameter.
exceptionMessage|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given exception message
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return jobs with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return jobs with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns jobs without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
locked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are locked.  If false, this parameter is ignored.
unlocked|query|boolean|false|If true, only return jobs which are unlocked. If false, this parameter is ignored.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.


#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
sort|id|
sort|dueDate|
sort|executionId|
sort|processInstanceId|
sort|retries|
sort|tenantId|

`POST /query/executions`

The request body can contain all possible filters that can be used in the List executions URL query. On top of these, it?s possible to provide an array of variables and processInstanceVariables to include in the query, with their format described here.

The general paging and sorting query-parameters can be used for this URL.

```json

  "start": 0,
  "size": 0,

  "order": "string",
  "id": "string",
  "activityId": "string",
  "parentId": "string",
  "processInstanceId": "string",

      "value": {},
      "type": "string",
      "variableOperation": "EQUALS"
    }

  "processInstanceVariables": [
    {
      "name": "string",
      "operation": "string",
      "value": {},
      "type": "string",
      "variableOperation": "EQUALS"
    }

  "tenantId": "string",
  "tenantIdLike": "string",

}
```

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
id|query|string|false|Only return models with the given version.
processDefinitionKey|query|string|false|Only return process instances with the given process definition key.
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|Only return process instances with the given process definition id.
businessKey|query|string|false|Only return process instances with the given businessKey.
involvedUser|query|string|false|Only return process instances in which the given user is involved.
suspended|query|boolean|false|If true, only return process instance which are suspended. If false, only return process instances which are not suspended (active).
superProcessInstanceId|query|string|false|Only return process instances which have the given super process-instance id (for processes that have a call-activities).
subProcessInstanceId|query|string|false|Only return process instances which have the given sub process-instance id (for processes started as a call-activity).
excludeSubprocesses|query|boolean|false|Return only process instances which aren?t sub processes.
includeProcessVariables|query|boolean|false|Indication to include process variables in the result.
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return process instances with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return process instances with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns process instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.

|---|---|

sort|processDefinitionId|
sort|tenantId|
sort|processDefinitionKey|

`POST /runtime/process-instances`

Note that also a *transientVariables* property is accepted as part of this json, that follows the same structure as the *variables* property.

Only one of *processDefinitionId*, *processDefinitionKey* or *message* can be used in the request body. 

Parameters *businessKey*, *variables* and *tenantId* are optional.

 If tenantId is omitted, the default tenant will be used. More information about the variable format can be found in the REST variables section.

 Note that the variable-scope that is supplied is ignored, process-variables are always local.

`POST /query/tasks`

All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of tasks (except for candidateGroupIn which is only available in this POST task query REST service), but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri?s that are too long. On top of that, the query allows for filtering based on task and process variables. The taskVariables and processInstanceVariables are both JSON-arrays containing objects with the format as described here.

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
name|query|string|false|Only return models with the given version.
nameLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks with a name like the given name.
description|query|string|false|Only return tasks with the given description.
priority|query|string|false|Only return tasks with the given priority.
minimumPriority|query|string|false|Only return tasks with a priority greater than the given value.
maximumPriority|query|string|false|Only return tasks with a priority lower than the given value.
assignee|query|string|false|Only return tasks assigned to the given user.
assigneeLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks assigned with an assignee like the given value.
owner|query|string|false|Only return tasks owned by the given user.
ownerLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks assigned with an owner like the given value.
unassigned|query|string|false|Only return tasks that are not assigned to anyone. If false is passed, the value is ignored.
delegationState|query|string|false|Only return tasks that have the given delegation state. Possible values are pending and resolved.
candidateUser|query|string|false|Only return tasks that can be claimed by the given user. This includes both tasks where the user is an explicit candidate for and task that are claimable by a group that the user is a member of.
candidateGroup|query|string|false|Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given group.
candidateGroups|query|string|false|Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given groups. Values split by comma.
involvedUser|query|string|false|Only return tasks in which the given user is involved.
taskDefinitionKey|query|string|false|Only return tasks with the given task definition id.
taskDefinitionKeyLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks with a given task definition id like the given value.
processInstanceId|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given id.
processInstanceBusinessKey|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given business key.
processInstanceBusinessKeyLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of the process instance which has a business key like the given value.
processDefinitionId|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given id.
processDefinitionKey|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given key.
processDefinitionKeyLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with a key like the given value.
processDefinitionName|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given name.
processDefinitionNameLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with a name like the given value.
executionId|query|string|false|Only return tasks which are part of the execution with the given id.
createdOn|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are created on the given date.
createdBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are created before the given date.
createdAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are created after the given date.
dueOn|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are due on the given date.
dueBefore|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are due before the given date.
dueAfter|query|string(date-time)|false|Only return tasks which are due after the given date.
withoutDueDate|query|boolean|false|Only return tasks which don?t have a due date. The property is ignored if the value is false.
excludeSubTasks|query|boolean|false|Only return tasks that are not a subtask of another task.
active|query|boolean|false|If true, only return tasks that are not suspended (either part of a process that is not suspended or not part of a process at all). If false, only tasks that are part of suspended process instances are returned.
includeTaskLocalVariables|query|boolean|false|Indication to include task local variables in the result.
includeProcessVariables|query|boolean|false|Indication to include process variables in the result.
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return tasks with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return tasks with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns tasks without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
candidateOrAssigned|query|string|false|Select tasks that has been claimed or assigned to user or waiting to claim by user (candidate user or groups).
category|query|string|false|Select tasks with the given category. Note that this is the task category, not the category of the process definition (namespace within the BPMN Xml).

`PUT /runtime/tasks/{taskId}`

All request values are optional. For example, you can only include the assignee attribute in the request body JSON-object, only updating the assignee of the task, leaving all other fields unaffected. When an attribute is explicitly included and is set to null, the task-value will be updated to null. Example: {"dueDate" : null} will clear the duedate of the task).

`POST /runtime/tasks/{taskId}/variables`

This endpoint can be used in 2 ways: By passing a JSON Body (RestVariable or an Array of RestVariable) or by passing a multipart/form-data Object.
 It's possible to create simple (non-binary) variable or list of variables or new binary variable 
Any number of variables can be passed into the request body array.
NB: The multipart/form-data approach is not documented for this endpoint due to design restriction.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "name": "myVariable",
  "type": "string",
  "value": "test",
  "valueUrl": "http://....",
  "scope": "string"
}
```
### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
taskId|path|string|true|No description
body|body|[RestVariable](#schemarestvariable)|false|Create a variable on a task

`POST /repository/deployments`

The request body should contain data of type multipart/form-data. There should be exactly one file in the request, any additional files will be ignored. The deployment name is the name of the file-field passed in. If multiple resources need to be deployed in a single deployment, compress the resources in a zip and make sure the file-name ends with .bar or .zip.

An additional parameter (form-field) can be passed in the request body with name tenantId. The value of this field will be used as the id of the tenant this deployment is done in.

> Body parameter

```yaml
string

```

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
deploymentKey|query|string|false|No description
deploymentName|query|string|false|No description
tenantId|query|string|false|No description
body|body|[updateUserPicture](#schema+updateuserpicture)(binary)|true|No description

`GET /repository/models`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
id|query|string|false|Only return models with the given version.
category|query|string|false|Only return models with the given category.
categoryLike|query|string|false|Only return models with a category like the given name.
categoryNotEquals|query|string|false|Only return models which don?t have the given category.
name|query|string|false|Only return models with the given name.
nameLike|query|string|false|Only return models with a name like the given name.
key|query|string|false|Only return models with the given key.
deploymentId|query|string|false|Only return models with the given category.
version|query|integer|false|Only return models with the given version.
latestVersion|query|boolean|false|If true, only return models which are the latest version. Best used in combination with key. If false is passed in as value, this is ignored and all versions are returned.
deployed|query|boolean|false|If true, only deployed models are returned. If false, only undeployed models are returned (deploymentId is null).
tenantId|query|string|false|Only return models with the given tenantId.
tenantIdLike|query|string|false|Only return models with a tenantId like the given value.
withoutTenantId|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns models without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.


#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
sort|id|
sort|category|
sort|createTime|
sort|key|
sort|lastUpdateTime|
sort|name|
sort|version|
sort|tenantId|

`GET /repository/process-definitions`

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
version|query|integer|false|Only return process definitions with the given version.
name|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with the given name.
nameLike|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with a name like the given name.
key|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with the given key.
keyLike|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with a name like the given key.
resourceName|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with the given resource name.
resourceNameLike|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with a name like the given resource name.
category|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with the given category.
categoryLike|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with a category like the given name.
categoryNotEquals|query|string|false|Only return process definitions which don?t have the given category.
deploymentId|query|string|false|Only return process definitions with the given category.
startableByUser|query|string|false|Only return process definitions which are part of a deployment with the given id.
latest|query|boolean|false|Only return the latest process definition versions. Can only be used together with key and keyLike parameters, using any other parameter will result in a 400-response.
suspended|query|boolean|false|If true, only returns process definitions which are suspended. If false, only active process definitions (which are not suspended) are returned.
sort|query|string|false|Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.


#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
sort|name|
sort|id|
sort|key|
sort|category|
sort|deploymentId|
sort|version|

> Example responses

```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "oneTaskProcess:1:4",
      "url": "http://localhost:8182/repository/process-definitions/oneTaskProcess%3A1%3A4",
      "key": "oneTaskProcess",
      "version": 1,
      "name": "The One Task Process",
      "description": "This is a process for testing purposes",
      "tenantId": "null",
      "deploymentId": "2",
      "deploymentUrl": "http://localhost:8081/repository/deployments/2",
      "resource": "http://localhost:8182/repository/deployments/2/resources/testProcess.xml",
      "diagramResource": "http://localhost:8182/repository/deployments/2/resources/testProcess.png",
      "category": "Examples",
      "graphicalNotationDefined": true,
      "suspended": true,
      "startFormDefined": true
    }
  ],
  "total": 0,
  "start": 0,
  "sort": "string",
  "order": "string",
  "size": 0
}
```
### Responses

Status|Meaning|Description|Schema
---|---|---|---|
200|[OK](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.1)|Indicates request was successful and the process-definitions are returned|[DataResponseProcessDefinitionResponse](#schemadataresponseprocessdefinitionresponse)
400|[Bad Request](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1)|Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format or that latest is used with other parameters other than key and keyLike. The status-message contains additional information.|None

`POST /runtime/process-instances/{processInstanceId}/variables`

This endpoint can be used in 2 ways: By passing a JSON Body (RestVariable or an array of RestVariable) or by passing a multipart/form-data Object.
 Nonexistent variables are created on the process-instance and existing ones are overridden without any error.
 Any number of variables can be passed into the request body array.
Note that scope is ignored, only local variables can be set in a process instance.
 NB: The multipart/form-data approach is not documented for this endpoint due to design restriction.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "name": "myVariable",
  "type": "string",
  "value": "test",
  "valueUrl": "http://....",
  "scope": "string"
}
```
### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
processInstanceId|path|string|true|No description
body|body|[RestVariable](#schemarestvariable)|false|Create a variable on a process instance
» name|body|string|false|Name of the variable
» type|body|string|false|Type of the variable.
» value|body|object|false|Value of the variable.
» valueUrl|body|string|false|No description
» scope|body|string|false|No description


> Example responses

```json
{}
```
### Responses

Status|Meaning|Description|Schema
---|---|---|---|
200|[OK](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.1)|successful operation|object
201|[Created](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.2)|Indicates the process instance was found and variable is created.|None
400|[Bad Request](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1)|Indicates the request body is incomplete or contains illegal values. The status description contains additional information about the error.|None
404|[Not Found](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4)|Indicates the requested process instance was not found.|None
409|[Conflict](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.8)|Indicates the process instance was found but already contains a variable with the given name (only thrown when POST method is used). Use the update-method instead.|None

`POST /runtime/signals`

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "signalName": "string",
  "variables": [
    {
      "name": "myVariable",
      "type": "string",
      "value": "test",
      "valueUrl": "http://....",
      "scope": "string"
    }
  ],
  "tenantId": "string",
  "async": true
}
```
### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
body|body|[SignalEventReceivedRequest](#schemasignaleventreceivedrequest)|false|No description
» signalName|body|string|false|Name of the signal
» tenantId|body|string|false|ID of the tenant that the signal event should be processed in
» async|body|boolean|false|If true, handling of the signal will happen asynchronously. Return code will be 202 - Accepted to indicate the request is accepted but not yet executed. If false,
» variables|body|[[RestVariable](#schemarestvariable)]|false|Array of variables (in the general variables format) to use as payload to pass along with the signal. Cannot be used in case async is set to true, this will result in an error.
»» name|body|string|false|Name of the variable
»» type|body|string|false|Type of the variable.
»» value|body|object|false|Value of the variable.
»» valueUrl|body|string|false|No description
»» scope|body|string|false|No description


##### » async
If true, handling of the signal will happen asynchronously. Return code will be 202 - Accepted to indicate the request is accepted but not yet executed. If false,
                    handling the signal will be done immediately and result (200 - OK) will only return after this completed successfully. Defaults to false if omitted.
### Responses

Status|Meaning|Description|Schema
---|---|---|---|
202|[Accepted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.3)|Indicated signal processing is queued as a job, ready to be executed.|None
204|[No Content](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.5)|Indicated signal has been processed and no errors occurred.|None
400|[Bad Request](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1)|Signal not processed. The signal name is missing or variables are used together with async, which is not allowed. Response body contains additional information about the error.|None

</aside>

This endpoint can be used in 2 ways: By passing a JSON Body (AttachmentRequest) to link an external resource or by passing a multipart/form-data Object to attach a file.
NB: The JSON approach is not documented for this endpoint due to design restriction.

```yaml
name: string
description: string
type: string
```

taskId|path|string|true|No description
body|body|object|false|No description
» name|body|string|false|Required name of the variable
» description|body|string|false|Description of the attachment, optional
» type|body|string|false|Type of attachment, optional. Supports any arbitrary string or a valid HTTP content-type.

Any number of variables can be passed into the request body array.

```java
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());
```

`GET /runtime/tasks/{taskId}/variables/{variableName}/data`

The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

### Parameters

Parameter|In|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
taskId|path|string|true|No description
variableName|path|string|true|No description
scope|query|string|false|Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task?s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.


> Example responses

```json
[
  "string"
]
```
### Responses

Status|Meaning|Description|Schema
---|---|---|---|
200|[OK](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.1)|Indicates the task was found and the requested variables are returned.|Inline
404|[Not Found](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4)|Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn?t have a variable with the given name (in the given scope). Status message provides additional information.|None

### Response Schema

Status Code **200**

Name|Type|Required|Description
---|---|---|---|---|
anonymous|[string(byte)]|false|No description



<aside class="warning">
To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods:
http
</aside>

Name|Type|Required|Description

category|string|false|No description
